Abandoned Chat: Empty fields, greetings only, or just 'library help' with no intent.
Borrow Tech: Laptops, chargers, tablets, cameras, tripods, VR equipment, calculators or other hardware loans.
Campus Services: non-library services offered on campus (e.g., tutoring, writing support, IT help, financial aid, counseling, dining).
Campus Wayfinding: Directions to physical locations elsewhere on campus. DISTINCTION: Does Not include finding campus services online. That would code as 'Campus Services'.
Citations & Citing Sources: citation styles (APA, MLA, etc.), requests for citation style manuals or resources, tools such as Endnote, or avoiding plagiarism.
Connectivity & Remote Access Issues: Technical barriers preventing access to digital content. Includes: Login/password failures, VPN/Proxy errors, NetID authentication, and broken database links. DISTINCTION: Use this for 'getting into' resources; use 'Patron Account' only for administrative status.
Course Reserves: materials (electronic or physical) such as books, articles, media, or personal instructor copies on reserve with the library specifically set aside for a class to use to ensure high-demand items are available to all students. DISTINCTION:  Does not include need to purchase books for a course from the campus bookstore.
Database Search Skills: Using search tools in databases such as filters or Boolean operators, include library catalog as a database.
Develop Research Topic: Brainstorming, narrowing or refining a research question.
Evaluation Information: Assessing credibility or quality of sources.
Faculty Instruction Support: Specific support for class tours, pedagogy, syllabus design, or classroom curriculum. Includes an instructor requesting resources, access, or technical help specifically for use by their students or course/class.  DISTINCTION: Do NOT use this just because the patron is faculty.
Find by Author: Requests where the PATRON asks  to locate books, articles, or resources written, edited, or produced by a specific person or organization.
Finding Relevant Resources: Identifying topic-specific information resources from inquiries where the patron provides a topic, genre, or course code (e.g., 'books for ENG 101') rather than a specific title. DISTINCTION: This code remains active if a Librarian suggests specific titles to a topic-searching patron. These titles are 'search results', not 'Known Items'.
Fines & Fees: Patron fines or payment procedures, billing issues.
Hold Request: Placing or managing request by a library patron to reserve a specific item, such as a book, movie, or other material for personal use.  This may include placing the request, notification, pickup, delivery or checking user account for status. including delivery of local library materials to other campus locations for pickup.
Hours: Opening/closing times of the library or specific library departments or services. DISTINCTION: This does not include hours for other campus or community services.
Interlibrary Loan: Library service allowing patrons to borrow materials from other libraries when their local library does not own or have local access. Includes document delivery services. Includes physical or access to electronic materials (books, media) or receive copies of documents (articles, chapters) .
Find a Known Item: Journals, Periodicals: Requests where the PATRON asks for specific journals, magazines, individual articles, government documents, reports, serials or newspapers by title or other key metadata used to find a specific item.
Known Item: AV: Requests where the PATRON provides specific title or call number for physical, digital, or streaming videos, audio recordings, music. DISTINCTION: This does not include music scores.
Known Item: Book: Requests where the PATRON asks for specific books or book chapters by title, call number, direct URL or ISBN.
Known Item: Other: Requests where the PATRON asks for specific items such as kits, maps, tools, games, maps, musical scores, datasets or anatomy boxes.
Known Item: Thesis: Requests where the PATRON asks for specific academic theses or dissertations.
Library Services: information about or referral to library services such as research assistance, information literacy instruction, assisting with publishing, bibliometrics, open educational resources (OER), managing research data. makerspace use, and technology access, workshops.
Lost Items: Items borrowed by the patron they are reporting lost or billed by library as lost.
Navigation & Wayfinding: Locating areas, physical items on shelf, collections, restrooms or services in a library location.
Noise Issues: Concerns about noise levels or quiet areas.
Other: Inquiries not fitting in any above category. Includes building and facility issues not related to noise. MANDATORY: All offers of donations, book gifts, or material contributions MUST be coded here. Do NOT invent a 'Donation' code.
Patron Account: library user accounts, library card, or account status.
Physical Accessibility: Inquiries about ADA access, ADA software or elevators.
Policies & Procedures: library rules, borrowing limits, conduct policies, or service guidelines.
Printing & Scanning: Printing, scanning, or reporting equipment issues. 3D print
Research Strategy: Broad help on how to begin or improve research.
Safety & Security: Personal safety or security, emergency procedures, or the presence of security personnel.
Software: Assistance with availability, installation or use of specialized computer applications and tools (e.g., SPSS, PowerPoint, Excel spreadsheets, or Adobe Suite). This includes troubleshooting software-specific functions but excludes general hardware connectivity.
Study Rooms & Reservations: Booking or availability of group study or quiet study rooms including policies, and equipment.
System Test: Use of 'training chat' or 'system test' or the word 'test' with no other intent.
Tech Support: Help with frozen computers or equipment login.
Website: Issues or questions navigating the library site or scheduling appointments.
Request Purchase: Requests for the library to acquire a new title or institutional license. DISTINCTION: This is for institutional acquisition only. Does NOT include questions about the number of available licenses or personal fines, library card fees, or 'buying' a replacement for a lost item.
